definition: Policies and measures related to planning, financing, and managing basic urban infrastructure and services such as roads, water, sanitation, drainage, solid waste, public spaces, and community facilities.
Policies addressing housing supply, quality, affordability, regularization of informal settlements, slum upgrading, and resettlement or relocation programs.
Policies on spatial planning, zoning, land management, densification, mixed-use development, and alignment of land use plans with infrastructure and service provision.
Policies to increase urban resilience to climate change and natural hazards, including flood and storm protection, resilient infrastructure design, and climate adaptation strategies.

Policies targeting reduced inequalities and improved inclusion for vulnerable groups (low-income communities, migrants, women, youth, Afro-descendants, Indigenous Peoples, etc.) in access to housing, services, and opportunities.
Policies to support local economic development, job creation, productive activities, urban regeneration, and improved conditions for businesses in cities.
Policies related to strengthening public institutions, coordination between agencies and levels of government, governance arrangements, regulatory frameworks, and implementation capacity.
Policies and instruments related to municipal finance, creditworthiness, debt management, subnational borrowing, budget allocation, and funding of urban investments.
Policies on environmental protection, pollution control, conservation and restoration of ecosystems, nature-based solutions, and sustainable use of natural resources in urban areas.
Policies addressing disaster risk identification, reduction, preparedness, emergency response, and recovery in cities and human settlements.
Policies and practices on data systems, indicators, monitoring frameworks, impact evaluation, reporting, and evidence-based decision-making in urban policy.
Policies supporting participation of communities, civil society, and local stakeholders in planning, implementation, and oversight of urban and housing interventions.
Policies explicitly integrating gender equality and diversity considerations in urban planning, housing programs, and service provision.

Policies fostering digital solutions, smart-city tools, innovative technologies, and new models for managing urban services and infrastructure.
